rule-11-10-a.test_description: A one story, one zone building has a single building area. There are no service water heaters in the baseline building. There are no applicable service water heater efficiency requirements.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #11, baseline column, a & b
standard.rule_description: The service water heating system type in the baseline building design shall match the minimum efficiency requirements in Section 7.4.2.

rule-11-10-b.test_description: A one story, one zone building has one gas storage water heater. The water heater input rating is between 75k-105kBtu/h, with 100 gallons storage capacity, 120 F setpoint temperature, and low draw pattern. The water heater efficiency is correctly modeled as 0.4162 UEF.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #11, baseline column, a & b
standard.rule_description: The service water heating system type in the baseline building design shall match the minimum efficiency requirements in Section 7.4.2.

rule-11-10-c.test_description: A one story, one zone building has one gas storage water heater. The water heater input rating is >105kBtu/h, with 50 gallons storage capacity. The water heater efficiency is correctly modeled as 80% Et and 928 Btu/h standby loss.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #11, baseline column, a & b
standard.rule_description: The service water heating system type in the baseline building design shall match the minimum efficiency requirements in Section 7.4.2.

rule-11-10-d.test_description: A one story, one zone building has one electric storage water heater. The water heater input rating is >12kW, with 100 gallons storage capacity. The water heater efficiency is correctly modeled with 0.57% per hour standby loss.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #11, baseline column, a & b
standard.rule_description: The service water heating system type in the baseline building design shall match the minimum efficiency requirements in Section 7.4.2.

rule-11-10-e.test_description: A one story, one zone building has one electric storage water heater. The water heater input rating is <=12kW, with 50 gallons storage capacity, and medium draw pattern. The water heater efficiency is correctly modeled with 0.9207 UEF.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #11, baseline column, a & b
standard.rule_description: The service water heating system type in the baseline building design shall match the minimum efficiency requirements in Section 7.4.2.

rule-11-10-f.test_description: A one story, one zone building has one gas storage water heater. The water heater input rating is <75kBtu/h, with 50 gallons storage capacity, and medium draw pattern. The water heater efficiency is correctly modeled as 0.5633 UEF.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #11, baseline column, a & b
standard.rule_description: The service water heating system type in the baseline building design shall match the minimum efficiency requirements in Section 7.4.2.

rule-11-10-g.test_description: A one story, one zone building has one gas storage water heater. The water heater input rating is between 75k-105kBtu/h, with 100 gallons storage capacity, and low draw pattern. The water heater efficiency is incorrectly modeled as 0.5 UEF.
rule-11-10-g.expected_raised_message_includes: The modeled efficiency or standby loss for the water heater does not match the expected values.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #11, baseline column, a & b
standard.rule_description: The service water heating system type in the baseline building design shall match the minimum efficiency requirements in Section 7.4.2.

rule-11-10-h.test_description: A one story, one zone building has one gas storage water heater. The water heater input rating is between 75k-105kBtu/h, with 130 gallons storage capacity, and low draw pattern. The water heater efficiency is supposed to follow Table 7.8 footnote d, but is incorrectly modeled as 0.4162 UEF.
rule-11-10-h.expected_raised_message_includes:
Based on the provided details, THERMAL_EFFICIENCY is an expected efficiency metric for this water heater, however it was not provided. Note that the specific requirements of 10 CFR 430 can be found in ASHRAE 90.1 Appendix F Table F-2.
Based on the provided details, STANDBY_LOSS_ENERGY is an expected efficiency metric for this water heater, however it was not provided. Note that the specific requirements of 10 CFR 430 can be found in ASHRAE 90.1 Appendix F Table F-2.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #11, baseline column, a & b
standard.rule_description: The service water heating system type in the baseline building design shall match the minimum efficiency requirements in Section 7.4.2.

rule-11-10-i.test_description: A one story, one zone building has one gas storage water. The water heater input rating is >105kBtu/h, with 50 gallons storage capacity. The water heater efficiency is correctly modeled as 80% Et but the 1,500 Btu/h standby loss exceeds the limit.
rule-11-10-i.expected_raised_message_includes: The modeled efficiency or standby loss for the water heater does not match the expected values.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #11, baseline column, a & b
standard.rule_description: The service water heating system type in the baseline building design shall match the minimum efficiency requirements in Section 7.4.2.

rule-11-10-j.test_description: A one story, one zone building has one oil-fired storage water heater. Natural gas is not available at the site so fuel oil was modeled in the baseline. Fuel oil is the incorrect fuel source for this exception to Table G3.1 #11 h.
rule-11-10-j.expected_raised_message_includes: Fuel type: FUEL_OIL is not a valid fuel type for a service water heating baseline system. According to ASHRAE 90.1 Table G3.1.1-2 service water heating equipment shall be either electric resistance or natural gas. According to ASHRAE 90.1 Table G3.1 #11 h, in cases where natural gas is specified as the baseline system, but there is no natural gas available on site, a propane system may be modeled.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #11, baseline column, a & b
standard.rule_description: The service water heating system type in the baseline building design shall match the minimum efficiency requirements in Section 7.4.2.

rule-11-10-k.test_description: A one story, one zone building has one gas storage water heater. The water heater input rating is >105kBtu/h, with 50 gallons storage capacity. The water heater efficiency is modeled with 80% Et but no standby loss is specified.
rule-11-10-k.expected_raised_message_includes: is an expected efficiency metric for this water heater, however it was not provided. Note that the specific requirements of 10 CFR 430 can be found in ASHRAE 90.1 Appendix F Table F-2.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #11, baseline column, a & b
standard.rule_description: The service water heating system type in the baseline building design shall match the minimum efficiency requirements in Section 7.4.2.

rule-11-10-l.test_description: A one story, one zone building has one electric storage water heater. The water heater input rating is <=12kW, with 100 gallons storage capacity, and medium draw pattern. The water heater efficiency is not enforcable for the system type.
rule-11-10-l.expected_raised_message_includes: The storage tank is between 55 and 100 gallons with a capacity <= 12kW (40945 btu/hr). The minimum efficiency requirements in 90.1 Section 7.4.2 point to 10 CFR 430 which provides a heat pump efficiency for water heaters in this capacity range which is not consistent with the efficiency of an electric resistance storage water heater which is the only electric SWH system type associated with the baseline for ASHRAE 90.1 Appendix G. Consequently, this rule was not able to be assessed for this service water heater. Note that the specific requirements of 10 CFR 430 can be found in ASHRAE 90.1 Appendix F Table F-2.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #11, baseline column, a & b
standard.rule_description: The service water heating system type in the baseline building design shall match the minimum efficiency requirements in Section 7.4.2.

rule-11-10-m.test_description: A one story, one zone building has one electric storage water heater. The water heater input rating is <=12kW, with 19 gallons storage capacity. The water heater details fall outside the range enforced by 90.1.
rule-11-10-m.expected_raised_message_includes: The storage tank volume falls outside the supported range based on the size categories in ASHRAE 90.1 Table 7.8 and in 10 CFR 430. Consequently, this rule was not assessed for this service water heater. Note that the specific requirements of 10 CFR 430 can be found in ASHRAE 90.1 Appendix F Table F-2.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #11, baseline column, a & b
standard.rule_description: The service water heating system type in the baseline building design shall match the minimum efficiency requirements in Section 7.4.2.

rule-11-10-n.test_description: A one story, one zone building has one electric storage water heater. The water heater input rating per storage volume greater than 4,000 (Btu/h)/gallon. The water heater does not qualify as a storage water heater based on these details.
rule-11-10-n.expected_raised_message_includes: Capacity per volume exceeds the limit of 4000 (Btu/hr)/gallon given for storage water heaters in ASHRAE 90.1 Table 7.8.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #11, baseline column, a & b
standard.rule_description: The service water heating system type in the baseline building design shall match the minimum efficiency requirements in Section 7.4.2.

rule-11-10-o.test_description: A one story, one zone building has one electric storage water heater. The water heater has an instantaneous heater tank type. The water heater does not qualify as a storage water heater based on these details.
rule-11-10-o.expected_raised_message_includes: The baseline water heater is of an Instantaneous type. All service water heaters in the baseline should be storage water heaters, according to Table G3.1 #11 Baseline Building Performance column and Table G3.1.1-2. Consequently, the efficiency of the modeled water heater was not assessed.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #11, baseline column, a & b
standard.rule_description: The service water heating system type in the baseline building design shall match the minimum efficiency requirements in Section 7.4.2.

rule-11-10-p.test_description: A one story, one zone building has one gas storage water heater. The water heater input rating is between 75k-105kBtu/h, with 100 gallons storage capacity, setpoint temperature greater than 180F, thermal efficiency of 0.8, and low draw pattern. The water heater efficiency is correctly modeled as 0.8 thermal efficiency and the system appears to meet requirements, but it cannot be determined definitively because standby loss was estimated.
rule-11-10-p.expected_raised_message_includes: This calculated loss is less than or equal to the expected loss. Rule passes if assessor determines that this equation is appropriate for this project.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #11, baseline column, a & b
standard.rule_description: The service water heating system type in the baseline building design shall match the minimum efficiency requirements in Section 7.4.2.

rule-11-10-q.test_description: A one story, one zone building has one gas storage water heater. The water heater input rating is between 75k-105kBtu/h, with 100 gallons storage capacity, setpoint temperature greater than 180F, thermal efficiency of 0.8, and low draw pattern. The water heater efficiency is correctly modeled as 0.8 thermal efficiency and the system does not appear to meet requirements, but it cannot be determined definitively because standby loss was estimated.
rule-11-10-q.expected_raised_message_includes: This calculated loss is greater than the expected loss. Rule fails unless the assessor determines that the standby loss is appropriate for this project.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #11, baseline column, a & b
standard.rule_description: The service water heating system type in the baseline building design shall match the minimum efficiency requirements in Section 7.4.2.

rule-11-10-r.test_description: A one story, one zone building has one gas storage water heater. The water heater input rating is between 75k-105kBtu/h, with 100 gallons storage capacity, setpoint temperature greater than 180F, thermal efficiency of 0.8, and low draw pattern. The water heater efficiency is correctly modeled as 0.8 thermal efficiency but the standby loss is not provided and cannot be estimated.
rule-11-10-r.expected_raised_message_includes: Based on the provided details, STANDBY_LOSS_ENERGY is an expected efficiency metric for this water heater, however it was not provided. Note that the specific requirements of 10 CFR 430 can be found in ASHRAE 90.1 Appendix F Table F-2.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #11, baseline column, a & b
standard.rule_description: The service water heating system type in the baseline building design shall match the minimum efficiency requirements in Section 7.4.2.
